intro: Microula oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, oblong leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually greenish-white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Microula oblongifolia is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
